data.name: Mystical Pattern Creator
data.description:
Once upon a time - wait - actually, forget that. Basically there was this king who had a secret lair created for him and the passcode involved a pattern which had a base repeated 69000 times, but with a twist. Can you figure out how to create this pattern, no matter what the base or the length is?

Create an algorithm within the function `create_pattern` which takes in a string, `base`, and an integer, `n`, and returns the following pattern using the `base` which is repeated `n` times.

Examples for `base = '.--.'`

If n = 1:

.--.

If n=2:

.--.-..--..-.--.

If n=3:

.--.-..--..-.--.-..-.--..--.-..--..-.--..--.-..-.--.-..--..-.--.

If n=4:

.--.-..--..-.--.-..-.--..--.-..--..-.--..--.-..-.--.-..--..-.--.-..-.--..--.-..-.--.-..--..-.--..--.-..--..-.--.-..-.--..--.-..- -..-.--..--.-..-.--.-..--..-.--..--.-..--..-.--.-..-.--..--.-..-.--.-..--..-.--.-..-.--..--.-..--..-.--..--.-..-.--.-..--..-.--.

And so on and so forth.

Here are the examples with the same base, but with the separate sections shown so as to make the pattern easier to understand:

If n = 1:

(.--.)

If n=2:

[(.--.)(-..-)(-..-)(.--.)]

If n=3:

{ [(.--.)(-..-)(-..-)(.--.)] [(-..-)(.--.)(.--.)(-..-)] [(-..-)(.--.)(.--.)(-..-)] [(.--.)(-..-)(-..-)(.--.)] }

More details:

Bases are always of length 4 and bases always have the same pattern of characters (e.g. | .--. | -..- | =--= | 6776 | etc.)

Good luck!
